summary.p: Haab thanks for Bullinger's report [not received]. Unfortunately, he does not have the time to inform Bullinger in detail, but Bullinger can learn more from Mayor [Hans Rudolf] Lavater.

- Just this much: Some wish that the Confederates mediate between Emperor [Charles V] and the Protestants. However, in his opinion, the Confederates would only make themselves look ridiculous in doing so.

div.p: The grace of the Almighty be with us all at all times. Dearly beloved, highly learned, gracious, dear sir, I thank you kindly for your report, etc. And although I would like to write to you much and in detail, I do not have the will. However, my gracious, dear Mayor Lavater will let you know how things stand.

As for the weather, some good-minded people think that we Confederates should offer ourselves as mediators between the Emperor and the Protestants, but at the moment I cannot find a good reason for this, as I fear we would be more mocked than appreciated.
May the divine will be done at all times according to His grace. Amen. In haste from Baden, Wednesday, the 7th of July at 3 in the afternoon in the year 1546.
M. Thumysen sends you warm greetings. Your ever faithful friend and benefactor, Hans Haab.
To the highly and well-learned Master Heinrich Bullinger, pastor at the Minster in Zurich, my gracious, dear lord and friend.
